    43â†’
    44â†’**Recent Trend:**
    45â†’
    46â†’- Last 5 plans: 5m, 4m, 6m, 7m, 9m
    47â†’- Trend: Stable
    48â†’
    49â†’Updated after each plan completion.
    50â†’
    51â†’## Accumulated Context
    52â†’
    53â†’### Decisions
    54â†’
    55â†’Decisions are logged in PROJECT.md Key Decisions table.
    56â†’Recent decisions affecting current work:
    57â†’
    58â†’| Decision                                                          | Phase     | Rationale                                                                                                        |
    59â†’| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
    60â†’| Replace PnP Modal SDK with MPC Core Kit                           | Phase 12  | Full MFA control, custom UX, programmatic factor mgmt                                                            |
    61â†’| CipherBox as identity provider (sub=userId)                       | Phase 12  | Enables multi-auth linking, less data to Web3Auth                                                                |
    62â†’| Identity trilemma: chose (wallet-only + unified) w/ SPOF          | Phase 12  | No mandatory email; SPOF mitigated by key export+IPFS                                                            |
    63â†’| Phase 12 split into 12, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4                          | Phase 12  | Foundation->device registry->SIWE->MFA dependency chain                                                          |
    64â†’| Core Kit WEB3AUTH_NETWORK uses DEVNET/MAINNET keys                | 12-02     | Different from PnP SDK's SAPPHIRE_DEVNET/SAPPHIRE_MAINNET                                                        |
    65â†’| CipherBox JWT for backend auth (not coreKit.signatures)           | 12-04     | Core Kit signatures are session tokens, not verifiable JWTs. Pass CipherBox-issued JWT with loginType 'corekit'  |
    66â†’| importTssKey via localStorage one-time read-and-delete            | 12-05     | PnP migration key consumed once then removed                                                                     |
    67â†’| E2E uses CipherBox login UI directly (no modal iframe)            | 12-05     | Simpler, more reliable than Web3Auth modal automation                                                            |
    68â†’| jose library for identity JWTs (not @nestjs/jwt)                  | 12-01     | Separate signing keys (RS256) and audience from internal                                                         |
    69â†’| Cross-auth-method email linking                                   | 12-01     | Same email across Google/email auth -> same user account                                                         |
    70â†’| ECIES re-wrapping for sharing (not proxy re-encryption)           | Research  | Same wrapKey() function, server sees only ciphertexts                                                            |
    71â†’| Versioning = stop unpinning old CIDs + metadata extension         | Research  | Nearly free on IPFS, no new crypto needed                                                                        |
    72â†’| Read-only sharing only (no multi-writer IPNS)                     | Research  | Unsolved problem, deferred to v3                                                                                 |
    73â†’| minisearch + idb for client-side search                           | Research  | ~8KB total, TypeScript-native, zero server interaction                                                           |
    74â†’| Wallet addr: SHA-256 hash + truncated display (no encrypt)        | 12.3-01   | Simpler than hash+encrypted; full plaintext never stored                                                         |
    75â†’| Auth types: email_passwordless->email, external_wallet->wallet    | 12.3-01   | Clean method-based naming for simplified auth type system                                                        |
    76â†’| derivationVersion removed (ADR-001 clean break)                   | 12.3-01   | DB will be wiped, no migration needed, clean Core Kit-only schema                                                |
    77â†’| Web3AuthVerifierService decoupled from auth.service               | 12.3-02   | No longer injected; all login/link flows use CipherBox JWT verification                                          |
    78â†’| LinkMethodDto uses auth method types directly                     | 12.3-02   | google/email/wallet instead of routing through social/external_wallet loginType                                  |
    79â†’| Vault export derivationInfo simplified to derivationMethod        | 12.3-02   | Always 'web3auth' for Core Kit users; no derivationVersion needed                                                |
    80â†’| connectAsync for wallet SIWE flow (not useEffect-based)           | 12.3-03   | Simpler async flow; avoids address-watching complexity                                                           |
    81â†’| Disconnect wagmi after SIWE verification                          | 12.3-03   | No persistent wallet connection needed; Core Kit handles ongoing auth                                            |
    82â†’| vaultKeypair naming for auth store keypair                        | 12.3-03   | Clear purpose naming; replaces misleading ADR-001 derivedKeypair                                                 |
    83â†’| Reuse login components in link mode (settings)                    | 12.3-04   | GoogleLoginButton/EmailLoginForm reused via callback props; no separate link components                          |
    84â†’| Multiple wallets allowed per account                              | 12.3-04   | Wallet always shows as available to link; CONTEXT.md requirement                                                 |
    85â†’| Cross-account collision via TypeORM Not()                         | 12.3-04   | Check same identifier with different userId before allowing link                                                 |
    86â†’| Vault IPNS: same salt, different HKDF info for domain separation  | 12.3.1-01 | HKDF info is primary domain separator; "cipherbox-vault-ipns-v1" vs registry's info                              |
    87â†’| rootIpnsPublicKey removed from EncryptedVaultKeys                 | 12.3.1-01 | Derivable from private key; reduces stored data, eliminates inconsistency                                        |
    88â†’| Google login hashes sub (not email) for identifierHash            | 12.3.1-02 | Sub is immutable Google user ID; email can change. Privacy-preserving lookup.                                    |
    89â†’| Cross-method email auto-linking removed                           | 12.3.1-02 | Each auth method is independent; users link explicitly via Settings, not auto-linked by email match              |
    90â†’| identifier column stores hash for all auth types                  | 12.3.1-02 | identifier=identifierHash for consistency; identifierDisplay holds human-readable value                          |
    91â†’| rootIpnsPublicKey removed from vault entity/DTO/API/frontend      | 12.3.1-03 | Derivable from privateKey via HKDF; reduces schema, eliminates inconsistency                                     |
    92â†’| Plan 04 work completed by Plan 03 broader scope                   | 12.3.1-04 | Desktop Rust, E2E helpers, controller spec changes committed in Plan 03 execution                                |
    93â†’| Auto-expire on read (no cron for 5min TTL)                        | 12.4-01   | Pending requests past TTL marked expired on getStatus; simpler than background cleanup                           |
    94â†’| Hard delete on cancel (not status change)                         | 12.4-01   | Cancelled requests have no audit value; 5min TTL keeps table small                                               |
    95â†’| loginWithCoreKit returns typed union (not void)                   | 12.4-02   | 'logged_in' or 'required_share' enables callers to branch without catching errors                                |
    96â†’| Placeholder publicKey for REQUIRED_SHARE temp auth                | 12.4-02   | 'pending-core-kit-{userId}' allows bulletin board API access before TSS key available                            |
    97â†’| Pending auth state in React useState (not Zustand)                | 12.4-02   | Component-scoped, cleared on unmount or logout; no need for global persistence                                   |
    98â†’| FactorInfo extended with additionalMetadata for device matching   | 12.4-03   | Core Kit shareDescriptions parsed to expose deviceId for factor-to-device matching                               |
    99â†’| ARIA tablist/tabpanel for Settings tab navigation                 | 12.4-03   | Proper accessibility roles for tab switching between Linked Methods and Security                                 |
   100â†’| Inline confirm pattern for destructive MFA actions                | 12.4-03   | Revoke/regenerate use inline confirm/cancel, not modal dialog, matching terminal aesthetic                       |
   101â†’| secp256k1.keygen() for ephemeral keypair generation               | 12.4-04   | Noble secp256k1 v3 API uses keygen() returning { secretKey, publicKey } instead of v2's utils.randomPrivateKey() |
   102â†’| MFA prompt dismissal persisted in localStorage by user email      | 12.4-04   | Key is cipherbox*mfa_prompt_dismissed*{email} for cross-session persistence, fallback to 'default'               |
   103â†’| DeviceApprovalModal mounted in AppShell after AppFooter           | 12.4-04   | Fixed overlay visible on all authenticated pages regardless of current route                                     |
   104â†’| LoginFooter extracted to avoid duplication in Login.tsx           | 12.4-04   | Three render paths (normal, waiting, recovery) share the same footer component                                   |
   105â†’| Generated client wrapper pattern for device-approval service      | 12.4-05   | deviceApprovalApi wraps Orval-generated functions for backward-compatible import surface                         |
   106â†’| tssPubKey defensive check as permanent enableMfa() guard          | 12.4-05   | Logs CRITICAL if keypair changes after MFA enrollment; does not throw (enrollment already succeeded)             |
   107â†’| VaultExport below tabs, not as a third tab                        | 12.5-01   | VaultExport is a utility action always visible, not a settings category                                          |
   108â†’| Merge Settings.tsx into SettingsPage (not re-route)               | 12.5-01   | SettingsPage is canonical routed component with AppShell; merging preserves existing routing and layout          |
   109â†’| Hardhat account #0 for wallet E2E test key                        | 12.5-02   | Well-known deterministic key; reproducible tests without real wallet funds                                       |
   110â†’| Wallet E2E tests validate UI flow independently of Core Kit       | 12.5-02   | TC09 accepts both redirect-to-files and error as valid; tests frontend wallet interaction                        |
   111â†’| UAT quality gate: 16 PASS / 19 SKIP / 1 NOTE (all documented)     | 12.5-03   | Destructive and multi-device tests skipped with reasons; all 4 issues resolved; gate passed for Phase 12.1       |
   112â†’| File metadata encrypted with parent folderKey (not file's key)    | 12.6-01   | Consistent with folder metadata access control pattern; parent key controls child access                         |
   113â†’| encryptionMode optional with GCM default in validator             | 12.6-01   | Phase 12.1 AES-CTR files set 'CTR' explicitly; omission defaults to 'GCM' for backward compat                    |
   114â†’| fileId minimum 10 chars validation                                | 12.6-01   | Ensures UUID-length identifiers; prevents accidental short strings in HKDF info                                  |
   115â†’| Partial success for batch publish (per-record results)            | 12.6-02   | Failed records logged and counted, not re-thrown; batch returns totalSucceeded/totalFailed                       |
   116â†’| Concurrency=10 for batch delegated routing calls                  | 12.6-02   | Promise.allSettled in groups of 10 to avoid overwhelming delegated-ipfs.dev                                      |
   117â†’| Orphaned TEE enrollment on file delete left to expire             | 12.6-03   | No unenrollIpns REST API yet; 24h IPNS lifetime, Phase 14 adds explicit cleanup                                  |
   118â†’| deleteFolder returns fileMetaIpnsName list (not CIDs) for v2      | 12.6-03   | v2 FilePointers have no inline CID; caller resolves IPNS to get CID for unpinning                                |
   119â†’| replaceFileInFolder publishes only file IPNS (folder untouched)   | 12.6-03   | Primary optimization of per-file IPNS: content update skips folder metadata entirely                             |
   120â†’| DetailsDialog parentFolderId prop removed                         | 12.6-04   | IPNS resolution uses item's own IPNS name directly; parent folder lookup no longer needed                        |
   121â†’| Inline base36 + protobuf for IPNS name in recovery.html           | 12.6-05   | No libp2p CDN dependency needed; self-contained BigInt-based implementation                                      |
   122â†’| IPNS failures non-blocking in recovery tool                       | 12.6-05   | Warn and continue; collect failures, report at end with IPNS names for manual recovery                           |
   123â†’| Post-build script for SW compilation (not Vite plugin)            | 12.1-03   | Vite 7 Environment API breaks Rollup output hooks in standard plugins; build-sw.mjs via Vite lib-mode is simpler |
   124â†’| Separate tsconfig.sw.json for WebWorker lib types                 | 12.1-03   | SW runs in ServiceWorkerGlobalScope, needs WebWorker lib; excluded from main tsconfig to avoid type conflicts    |
   125â†’| Dev mode serves SW as raw TS, production as compiled IIFE         | 12.1-03   | Vite dev server transforms TS on-the-fly; production uses minified 2.8KB IIFE at /decrypt-sw.js                  |
   126â†’| Dual-hook pattern for streaming vs blob URL preview               | 12.1-04   | Both useStreamingPreview and useFilePreview called; open flag controls which is active                           |
   127â†’| isCtr return from useStreamingPreview for mode detection          | 12.1-04   | Caller knows if file is CTR-encrypted without separate metadata lookup                                           |
   128â†’| SW body streaming with getReader() for progress tracking          | 12.1-04   | Changed from arrayBuffer() to chunk-by-chunk reading for postMessage progress                                    |
   129â†’| Ctr64BE matches Web Crypto AES-CTR length:64                      | 11.1-01   | Cross-platform compatibility for desktop decrypting web-encrypted CTR files                                      |
   130â†’| FileMetadata encryptionMode serde default "GCM"                   | 11.1-01   | Matches TypeScript optional field behavior for backward compat                                                   |
   131â†’| sanitize_error uses char-walking (not regex crate)                | 11.1-02   | Avoids adding regex dependency for simple path/token replacement                                                 |
   132â†’| dev_key field always present in AppState (not cfg-gated)          | 11.1-02   | Simplifies struct; only CLI parsing is cfg(debug_assertions) gated                                               |
   133â†’| Keep v1 write-back format for build_folder_metadata               | 11.1-03   | SUPERSEDED by 11.2: Desktop now creates per-file IPNS records and writes v2 format exclusively                   |
   134â†’| Synthetic v1 cache entries for v2 folders (version='v2')          | 11.1-03   | Preserves MetadataCache staleness-check API without storing AnyFolderMetadata                                    |
   135â†’| Eager FilePointer resolution before NFS mount                     | 11.1-03   | NFS caches READDIR aggressively; first response must be complete and correct                                     |
   136â†’| AnyFolderMetadata Clone/Debug + to_v1() for FUSE compat           | 11.1-04   | Converts v2 FilePointers to placeholder FileEntries for backward-compatible FUSE layer                           |
   137â†’| Dev-key auth via test-login endpoint for CI/debug                 | 11.1-04   | Debug builds use POST /auth/test-login to get JWT, bypassing Core Kit entirely                                   |
   138â†’| Manual EIP-4361 SIWE message (no viem dependency for desktop)     | 11.1-07   | Raw string construction avoids heavy viem/wagmi deps; backend parseSiweMessage accepts standard format           |
   139â†’| Typed enums for DeviceAuthStatus/DevicePlatform (not raw strings) | 11.1-06   | Compile-time safety with serde rename_all lowercase for JSON compatibility                                       |
   140â†’| Fire-and-forget tokio::spawn for device registry                  | 11.1-06   | Non-blocking: failures logged but never block login flow                                                         |
   141â†’| Keychain-backed persistent device ID with UUID v4                 | 11.1-06   | keyring crate with delete-before-write pattern to avoid macOS "already exists" error                             |
   142â†’| ECIES key exchange for desktop device approval (not plaintext)    | 11.1-05   | Matches web app pattern; ephemeral secp256k1 keypair + wrapKey/unwrapKey from @cipherbox/crypto                  |
   143â†’| Module-level JWT/token state for MFA flow (not localStorage)      | 11.1-05   | Sensitive tokens cleared on auth completion; avoids persisting temporary access tokens                           |
   144â†’| isFilePointer simplified to type discriminant only                | 11.2-01   | All file children are FilePointer; no need to check for fileMetaIpnsName presence                                |
   145â†’| validateFolderMetadata rejects v1 with CryptoError                | 11.2-01   | Strict enforcement: only v2 schema accepted, not silent v1 acceptance                                            |
   146â†’| decrypt_folder_metadata rejects non-v2 with version check         | 11.2-02   | Strict validation: parses JSON, checks version field is "v2", rejects anything else with DeserializationFailed   |
   147â†’| FilePointer with None ipns_name uses empty string placeholder     | 11.2-02   | Newly created files before IPNS publish use "" with warning log; Plan 03 addresses deriving IPNS in create()     |
   148â†’| file_ipns_private_key stored on InodeKind::File                   | 11.2-03   | Option<Zeroizing<Vec<u8>>> for IPNS signing; matches folder IPNS key pattern                                     |
   149â†’| build_folder_metadata skips files without file_meta_ipns_name     | 11.2-03   | Error log + continue instead of empty placeholder; create() always derives IPNS name                             |
   150â†’| Per-file IPNS publish reuses PublishCoordinator                   | 11.2-03   | Same monotonic sequence number management as folder publishes                                                    |
   151â†’| VersionEntry encryptionMode is required (not optional)            | 13-01     | Past versions always record explicit encryption mode; no default needed                                          |
   152â†’| versions array omitted when undefined/empty (not null/[])         | 13-01     | Clean JSON for non-versioned files; backward compatible                                                          |
   153â†’| shouldCreateVersion returns true for first version (no prior)     | 13-02     | First save always creates baseline version even without forceVersion                                             |
   154â†’| Text editor cooldown, web re-upload forceVersion                  | 13-02     | Text editor defaults to 15min cooldown; re-upload passes forceVersion: true when added                           |
   155â†’| prunedCids returned from service, caller handles unpinning        | 13-02     | Separation of concerns: service determines what to prune, caller does I/O                                        |
   156â†’| VERSION_COOLDOWN_MS=15min, MAX_VERSIONS_PER_FILE=10 in FUSE       | 13-03     | Desktop FUSE versioning constants match CONTEXT.md spec and web behavior                                         |
   157â†’| Old file CID preserved on FUSE update (not unpinned)              | 13-03     | Enables version history referencing pinned IPFS content; only pruned excess unpinned                             |
   158â†’| InodeKind::File extended with versions field                      | 13-03     | Carries version history from IPNS resolution through inode lifecycle to release()                                |
   159â†’| parentFolderId re-added to DetailsDialog for version operations   | 13-04     | Needed for useFolder restoreVersion/deleteVersion which require parent context                                   |
   160â†’| Version numbering: v1=oldest, vN=newest in display                | 13-04     | Intuitive for users; reversed from array order where index 0=newest                                              |
   161â†’| metadataRefresh counter for post-action IPNS re-resolution        | 13-04     | Simple useEffect dependency to force re-fetch after restore/delete                                               |
   162â†’| AES-CTR decrypt added to recovery tool for version support        | 13-05     | Versions may use CTR encryption mode; recovery tool needs both GCM and CTR decryption                            |
   163â†’
   164â†’### Pending Todos
   165â†’
   166â†’8 pending todo(s):
   167â†’
   168â†’- `2026-02-07-web-worker-large-file-encryption.md` -- Offload large file encryption to Web Worker (area: ui)
   169â†’- `2026-02-14-bring-your-own-ipfs-node.md` -- Add bring-your-own IPFS node support (area: api)
   170â†’- `2026-02-14-erc-1271-contract-wallet-authentication.md` -- Add ERC-1271 contract wallet authentication support (area: auth)
   171â†’- `2026-02-15-security-review-medium-term-fixes.md` -- Security review medium-term fixes: H-08, M-07, M-11 (area: auth)
   172â†’- `2026-02-20-desktop-auto-update.md` -- Add auto-update to desktop app via Tauri updater plugin (area: desktop)
   173â†’- `2026-02-21-move-root-folder-key-to-ipfs.md` -- Move rootFolderKey to IPFS vault record, eliminate server-side key storage (area: crypto)
   174â†’- `2026-02-21-ipns-resolution-alternatives.md` -- Investigate alternatives to delegated-ipfs.dev for IPNS resolution (area: api)
   175â†’- `2026-02-21-desktop-tee-enrollment-for-new-files.md` -- Desktop TEE enrollment for new files (area: desktop)
   176â†’
   177â†’### Roadmap Evolution
   178â†’
   179â†’- Phase 12.1 inserted after Phase 12: AES-256-CTR streaming encryption for media files (INSERTED) â€” previously deferred as "future enhancement," promoted to M2 for early delivery after MFA stabilizes key derivation
   180â†’- Phase 12 rescoped from "MFA config" to "Core Kit Identity Provider Foundation" â€” PnP Modal SDK rejected for insufficient control
   181â†’- Phase 12.2 inserted: Encrypted Device Registry on IPFS â€” infrastructure for cross-device approval
   182â†’- Phase 12.3 inserted: SIWE + Unified Identity â€” wallet login unification, multi-auth linking
   183â†’- Phase 12.4 inserted: MFA + Cross-Device Approval â€” the actual MFA enrollment and device approval features
   184â†’- Phase 12.3.1 inserted after Phase 12.3: Pre-Wipe Identity Cleanup â€” deterministic IPNS derivation, SHA-256 hashed identifiers for all auth methods, remove cross-method email auto-linking. Done before DB wipe to avoid migration code.
   185â†’- Phase 12.5 inserted after Phase 12.4: MFA Polishing, UAT & E2E Testing â€” polish auth flows, add wallet E2E with mock EIP-1193/6963 provider, fix bugs from CoreKit auth UAT
   186â†’- Phase 12.6 inserted after Phase 12.5: Per-File IPNS Metadata Split â€” split file metadata into per-file IPNS records before vault wipe (clean break, no dual-schema). Phase 12.1 (AES-CTR) moved to after 12.6.
   187â†’- Phase 11.2 inserted after Phase 11.1: Remove v1 Folder Metadata â€” eliminate v1/v2 dual-schema code, make v2 FilePointer canonical everywhere, add per-file IPNS publishing to desktop FUSE. Triggered by cross-device format oscillation bug (desktop writes v1, web re-saves as v2 hybrid, desktop rejects).
   188â†’
   189â†’### Blockers/Concerns
   190â†’
   191â†’- Web3Auth custom JWT verifier: requires Growth Plan for production (free on devnet). Verify pricing before committing.
   192â†’- CipherBox as identity SPOF: backend is trust anchor for auth. Mitigated by encrypted key export + IPFS device registry. One-way door â€” verifierId scheme is permanent.
   193â†’- Versioning + Sharing interaction: When shared folder has version history, should recipient see all versions? Decide during Phase 14 planning.
   194â†’

## PLAN COMPLETE

**Plan:** 14-01
**Tasks:** 2/2
**SUMMARY:** `.planning/phases/14-user-to-user-sharing/14-01-SUMMARY.md`

**Commits:**

- `2eddb7614`: feat(14-01): add reWrapKey crypto utility for user-to-user sharing
- `23a6332c1`: feat(14-01): add Share and ShareKey TypeORM entities
- `dfabb36b1`: docs(14-01): complete crypto foundation & share entities plan

**Duration:** 7 min

**Key files created:**

- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/packages/crypto/src/ecies/rewrap.ts` -- reWrapKey function: unwrap with owner key, re-wrap with recipient key, zero plaintext
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/packages/crypto/src/__tests__/rewrap.test.ts` -- 4 test vectors verifying round-trip, multi-recipient, wrong key, invalid pubkey
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/apps/api/src/shares/entities/share.entity.ts` -- Share entity with Unique(sharer, recipient, ipnsName), revokedAt soft-delete, CASCADE on user delete
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/apps/api/src/shares/entities/share-key.entity.ts` -- ShareKey entity with CASCADE delete on share removal, Unique(share, keyType, itemId)
- `/Users/michael/Code/cipher-box/apps/api/src/shares/entities/index.ts` -- Barrel export

---

## Wave 1 Complete

**14-01: Crypto reWrapKey + Share/ShareKey Entities**
ECIES `reWrapKey` utility created with zero-plaintext-exposure pattern. Share and ShareKey TypeORM entities defined with proper cascading, unique constraints, and soft-delete revocation. 4 test vectors passing.

Wave 2 (backend shares module) can now build on these entities.

---

## Wave 2

**14-02: Backend Shares Module**
Builds the complete NestJS shares module with 8 REST endpoints covering create share, list shares, revoke, get shared-with-me items, and share key management. Includes DTOs, guards, and API client regeneration. This is the server-side backbone that frontend will call.

â—† Spawning 1 agent...

    49â†’
    50â†’Updated after each plan completion.
    51â†’
    52â†’## Accumulated Context
    53â†’
    54â†’### Decisions
    55â†’
    56â†’Decisions are logged in PROJECT.md Key Decisions table.
    57â†’Recent decisions affecting current work:
    58â†’
    59â†’| Decision                                                          | Phase     | Rationale                                                                                                        |
    60â†’| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
    61â†’| Replace PnP Modal SDK with MPC Core Kit                           | Phase 12  | Full MFA control, custom UX, programmatic factor mgmt                                                            |
    62â†’| CipherBox as identity provider (sub=userId)                       | Phase 12  | Enables multi-auth linking, less data to Web3Auth                                                                |
    63â†’| Identity trilemma: chose (wallet-only + unified) w/ SPOF          | Phase 12  | No mandatory email; SPOF mitigated by key export+IPFS                                                            |
    64â†’| Phase 12 split into 12, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4                          | Phase 12  | Foundation->device registry->SIWE->MFA dependency chain                                                          |
    65â†’| Core Kit WEB3AUTH_NETWORK uses DEVNET/MAINNET keys                | 12-02     | Different from PnP SDK's SAPPHIRE_DEVNET/SAPPHIRE_MAINNET                                                        |
    66â†’| CipherBox JWT for backend auth (not coreKit.signatures)           | 12-04     | Core Kit signatures are session tokens, not verifiable JWTs. Pass CipherBox-issued JWT with loginType 'corekit'  |
    67â†’| importTssKey via localStorage one-time read-and-delete            | 12-05     | PnP migration key consumed once then removed                                                                     |
    68â†’| E2E uses CipherBox login UI directly (no modal iframe)            | 12-05     | Simpler, more reliable than Web3Auth modal automation                                                            |
    69â†’| jose library for identity JWTs (not @nestjs/jwt)                  | 12-01     | Separate signing keys (RS256) and audience from internal                                                         |
    70â†’| Cross-auth-method email linking                                   | 12-01     | Same email across Google/email auth -> same user account                                                         |
    71â†’| ECIES re-wrapping for sharing (not proxy re-encryption)           | Research  | Same wrapKey() function, server sees only ciphertexts                                                            |
    72â†’| Versioning = stop unpinning old CIDs + metadata extension         | Research  | Nearly free on IPFS, no new crypto needed                                                                        |
    73â†’| Read-only sharing only (no multi-writer IPNS)                     | Research  | Unsolved problem, deferred to v3                                                                                 |
    74â†’| minisearch + idb for client-side search                           | Research  | ~8KB total, TypeScript-native, zero server interaction                                                           |
    75â†’| Wallet addr: SHA-256 hash + truncated display (no encrypt)        | 12.3-01   | Simpler than hash+encrypted; full plaintext never stored                                                         |
    76â†’| Auth types: email_passwordless->email, external_wallet->wallet    | 12.3-01   | Clean method-based naming for simplified auth type system                                                        |
    77â†’| derivationVersion removed (ADR-001 clean break)                   | 12.3-01   | DB will be wiped, no migration needed, clean Core Kit-only schema                                                |
    78â†’| Web3AuthVerifierService decoupled from auth.service               | 12.3-02   | No longer injected; all login/link flows use CipherBox JWT verification                                          |
    79â†’| LinkMethodDto uses auth method types directly                     | 12.3-02   | google/email/wallet instead of routing through social/external_wallet loginType                                  |
    80â†’| Vault export derivationInfo simplified to derivationMethod        | 12.3-02   | Always 'web3auth' for Core Kit users; no derivationVersion needed                                                |
    81â†’| connectAsync for wallet SIWE flow (not useEffect-based)           | 12.3-03   | Simpler async flow; avoids address-watching complexity                                                           |
    82â†’| Disconnect wagmi after SIWE verification                          | 12.3-03   | No persistent wallet connection needed; Core Kit handles ongoing auth                                            |
    83â†’| vaultKeypair naming for auth store keypair                        | 12.3-03   | Clear purpose naming; replaces misleading ADR-001 derivedKeypair                                                 |
    84â†’| Reuse login components in link mode (settings)                    | 12.3-04   | GoogleLoginButton/EmailLoginForm reused via callback props; no separate link components                          |
    85â†’| Multiple wallets allowed per account                              | 12.3-04   | Wallet always shows as available to link; CONTEXT.md requirement                                                 |
    86â†’| Cross-account collision via TypeORM Not()                         | 12.3-04   | Check same identifier with different userId before allowing link                                                 |
    87â†’| Vault IPNS: same salt, different HKDF info for domain separation  | 12.3.1-01 | HKDF info is primary domain separator; "cipherbox-vault-ipns-v1" vs registry's info                              |
    88â†’| rootIpnsPublicKey removed from EncryptedVaultKeys                 | 12.3.1-01 | Derivable from private key; reduces stored data, eliminates inconsistency                                        |
    89â†’| Google login hashes sub (not email) for identifierHash            | 12.3.1-02 | Sub is immutable Google user ID; email can change. Privacy-preserving lookup.                                    |
    90â†’| Cross-method email auto-linking removed                           | 12.3.1-02 | Each auth method is independent; users link explicitly via Settings, not auto-linked by email match              |
    91â†’| identifier column stores hash for all auth types                  | 12.3.1-02 | identifier=identifierHash for consistency; identifierDisplay holds human-readable value                          |
    92â†’| rootIpnsPublicKey removed from vault entity/DTO/API/frontend      | 12.3.1-03 | Derivable from privateKey via HKDF; reduces schema, eliminates inconsistency                                     |
    93â†’| Plan 04 work completed by Plan 03 broader scope                   | 12.3.1-04 | Desktop Rust, E2E helpers, controller spec changes committed in Plan 03 execution                                |
    94â†’| Auto-expire on read (no cron for 5min TTL)                        | 12.4-01   | Pending requests past TTL marked expired on getStatus; simpler than background cleanup                           |
    95â†’| Hard delete on cancel (not status change)                         | 12.4-01   | Cancelled requests have no audit value; 5min TTL keeps table small                                               |
    96â†’| loginWithCoreKit returns typed union (not void)                   | 12.4-02   | 'logged_in' or 'required_share' enables callers to branch without catching errors                                |
    97â†’| Placeholder publicKey for REQUIRED_SHARE temp auth                | 12.4-02   | 'pending-core-kit-{userId}' allows bulletin board API access before TSS key available                            |
    98â†’| Pending auth state in React useState (not Zustand)                | 12.4-02   | Component-scoped, cleared on unmount or logout; no need for global persistence                                   |
    99â†’| FactorInfo extended with additionalMetadata for device matching   | 12.4-03   | Core Kit shareDescriptions parsed to expose deviceId for factor-to-device matching                               |
   100â†’| ARIA tablist/tabpanel for Settings tab navigation                 | 12.4-03   | Proper accessibility roles for tab switching between Linked Methods and Security                                 |
   101â†’| Inline confirm pattern for destructive MFA actions                | 12.4-03   | Revoke/regenerate use inline confirm/cancel, not modal dialog, matching terminal aesthetic                       |
   102â†’| secp256k1.keygen() for ephemeral keypair generation               | 12.4-04   | Noble secp256k1 v3 API uses keygen() returning { secretKey, publicKey } instead of v2's utils.randomPrivateKey() |
   103â†’| MFA prompt dismissal persisted in localStorage by user email      | 12.4-04   | Key is cipherbox*mfa_prompt_dismissed*{email} for cross-session persistence, fallback to 'default'               |
   104â†’| DeviceApprovalModal mounted in AppShell after AppFooter           | 12.4-04   | Fixed overlay visible on all authenticated pages regardless of current route                                     |
   105â†’| LoginFooter extracted to avoid duplication in Login.tsx           | 12.4-04   | Three render paths (normal, waiting, recovery) share the same footer component                                   |
   106â†’| Generated client wrapper pattern for device-approval service      | 12.4-05   | deviceApprovalApi wraps Orval-generated functions for backward-compatible import surface                         |
   107â†’| tssPubKey defensive check as permanent enableMfa() guard          | 12.4-05   | Logs CRITICAL if keypair changes after MFA enrollment; does not throw (enrollment already succeeded)             |
   108â†’| VaultExport below tabs, not as a third tab                        | 12.5-01   | VaultExport is a utility action always visible, not a settings category                                          |
   109â†’| Merge Settings.tsx into SettingsPage (not re-route)               | 12.5-01   | SettingsPage is canonical routed component with AppShell; merging preserves existing routing and layout          |
   110â†’| Hardhat account #0 for wallet E2E test key                        | 12.5-02   | Well-known deterministic key; reproducible tests without real wallet funds                                       |
   111â†’| Wallet E2E tests validate UI flow independently of Core Kit       | 12.5-02   | TC09 accepts both redirect-to-files and error as valid; tests frontend wallet interaction                        |
   112â†’| UAT quality gate: 16 PASS / 19 SKIP / 1 NOTE (all documented)     | 12.5-03   | Destructive and multi-device tests skipped with reasons; all 4 issues resolved; gate passed for Phase 12.1       |
   113â†’| File metadata encrypted with parent folderKey (not file's key)    | 12.6-01   | Consistent with folder metadata access control pattern; parent key controls child access                         |
   114â†’| encryptionMode optional with GCM default in validator             | 12.6-01   | Phase 12.1 AES-CTR files set 'CTR' explicitly; omission defaults to 'GCM' for backward compat                    |
   115â†’| fileId minimum 10 chars validation                                | 12.6-01   | Ensures UUID-length identifiers; prevents accidental short strings in HKDF info                                  |
   116â†’| Partial success for batch publish (per-record results)            | 12.6-02   | Failed records logged and counted, not re-thrown; batch returns totalSucceeded/totalFailed                       |
   117â†’| Concurrency=10 for batch delegated routing calls                  | 12.6-02   | Promise.allSettled in groups of 10 to avoid overwhelming delegated-ipfs.dev                                      |
   118â†’| Orphaned TEE enrollment on file delete left to expire             | 12.6-03   | No unenrollIpns REST API yet; 24h IPNS lifetime, Phase 14 adds explicit cleanup                                  |
   119â†’| deleteFolder returns fileMetaIpnsName list (not CIDs) for v2      | 12.6-03   | v2 FilePointers have no inline CID; caller resolves IPNS to get CID for unpinning                                |
   120â†’| replaceFileInFolder publishes only file IPNS (folder untouched)   | 12.6-03   | Primary optimization of per-file IPNS: content update skips folder metadata entirely                             |
   121â†’| DetailsDialog parentFolderId prop removed                         | 12.6-04   | IPNS resolution uses item's own IPNS name directly; parent folder lookup no longer needed                        |
   122â†’| Inline base36 + protobuf for IPNS name in recovery.html           | 12.6-05   | No libp2p CDN dependency needed; self-contained BigInt-based implementation                                      |
   123â†’| IPNS failures non-blocking in recovery tool                       | 12.6-05   | Warn and continue; collect failures, report at end with IPNS names for manual recovery                           |
   124â†’| Post-build script for SW compilation (not Vite plugin)            | 12.1-03   | Vite 7 Environment API breaks Rollup output hooks in standard plugins; build-sw.mjs via Vite lib-mode is simpler |
   125â†’| Separate tsconfig.sw.json for WebWorker lib types                 | 12.1-03   | SW runs in ServiceWorkerGlobalScope, needs WebWorker lib; excluded from main tsconfig to avoid type conflicts    |
   126â†’| Dev mode serves SW as raw TS, production as compiled IIFE         | 12.1-03   | Vite dev server transforms TS on-the-fly; production uses minified 2.8KB IIFE at /decrypt-sw.js                  |
   127â†’| Dual-hook pattern for streaming vs blob URL preview               | 12.1-04   | Both useStreamingPreview and useFilePreview called; open flag controls which is active                           |
   128â†’| isCtr return from useStreamingPreview for mode detection          | 12.1-04   | Caller knows if file is CTR-encrypted without separate metadata lookup                                           |
   129â†’| SW body streaming with getReader() for progress tracking          | 12.1-04   | Changed from arrayBuffer() to chunk-by-chunk reading for postMessage progress                                    |
   130â†’| Ctr64BE matches Web Crypto AES-CTR length:64                      | 11.1-01   | Cross-platform compatibility for desktop decrypting web-encrypted CTR files                                      |
   131â†’| FileMetadata encryptionMode serde default "GCM"                   | 11.1-01   | Matches TypeScript optional field behavior for backward compat                                                   |
   132â†’| sanitize_error uses char-walking (not regex crate)                | 11.1-02   | Avoids adding regex dependency for simple path/token replacement                                                 |
   133â†’| dev_key field always present in AppState (not cfg-gated)          | 11.1-02   | Simplifies struct; only CLI parsing is cfg(debug_assertions) gated                                               |
   134â†’| Keep v1 write-back format for build_folder_metadata               | 11.1-03   | SUPERSEDED by 11.2: Desktop now creates per-file IPNS records and writes v2 format exclusively                   |
   135â†’| Synthetic v1 cache entries for v2 folders (version='v2')          | 11.1-03   | Preserves MetadataCache staleness-check API without storing AnyFolderMetadata                                    |
   136â†’| Eager FilePointer resolution before NFS mount                     | 11.1-03   | NFS caches READDIR aggressively; first response must be complete and correct                                     |
   137â†’| AnyFolderMetadata Clone/Debug + to_v1() for FUSE compat           | 11.1-04   | Converts v2 FilePointers to placeholder FileEntries for backward-compatible FUSE layer                           |
   138â†’| Dev-key auth via test-login endpoint for CI/debug                 | 11.1-04   | Debug builds use POST /auth/test-login to get JWT, bypassing Core Kit entirely                                   |
   139â†’| Manual EIP-4361 SIWE message (no viem dependency for desktop)     | 11.1-07   | Raw string construction avoids heavy viem/wagmi deps; backend parseSiweMessage accepts standard format           |

   151â†’| Per-file IPNS publish reuses PublishCoordinator                   | 11.2-03   | Same monotonic sequence number management as folder publishes                                                    |
   152â†’| VersionEntry encryptionMode is required (not optional)            | 13-01     | Past versions always record explicit encryption mode; no default needed                                          |
   153â†’| versions array omitted when undefined/empty (not null/[])         | 13-01     | Clean JSON for non-versioned files; backward compatible                                                          |
   154â†’| shouldCreateVersion returns true for first version (no prior)     | 13-02     | First save always creates baseline version even without forceVersion                                             |
   155â†’| Text editor cooldown, web re-upload forceVersion                  | 13-02     | Text editor defaults to 15min cooldown; re-upload passes forceVersion: true when added                           |
   156â†’| prunedCids returned from service, caller handles unpinning        | 13-02     | Separation of concerns: service determines what to prune, caller does I/O                                        |
   157â†’| VERSION_COOLDOWN_MS=15min, MAX_VERSIONS_PER_FILE=10 in FUSE       | 13-03     | Desktop FUSE versioning constants match CONTEXT.md spec and web behavior                                         |
   158â†’| Old file CID preserved on FUSE update (not unpinned)              | 13-03     | Enables version history referencing pinned IPFS content; only pruned excess unpinned                             |
   159â†’| InodeKind::File extended with versions field                      | 13-03     | Carries version history from IPNS resolution through inode lifecycle to release()                                |

   198â†’
   199â†’<task type="auto">
   200â†’  <name>Task 2: Create shares controller, module, register in app.module, and regenerate API client</name>
   201â†’  <files>
   202â†’    apps/api/src/shares/shares.controller.ts
   203â†’    apps/api/src/shares/shares.module.ts
   204â†’    apps/api/src/app.module.ts
   205â†’  </files>
   206â†’  <action>
   207â†’    **shares.controller.ts** -- REST controller with JWT auth guard. Follow DeviceApproval controller pattern:
   208â†’
   209â†’    All endpoints require `@UseGuards(JwtAuthGuard)` and extract userId from `@Req() req`.
   210â†’
   211â†’    Endpoints:
   212â†’    1. `@Post()` -- Create share. Body: CreateShareDto. Calls service.createShare(userId, dto). Returns 201 with share record (serialize encryptedKey as hex, include shareId).
   213â†’
   214â†’    2. `@Get('received')` -- List received shares. Calls service.getReceivedShares(userId). Map each share to response DTO: { shareId, sharerPublicKey (from sharer relation), itemType, ipnsName, itemName, encryptedKey (Buffer to hex), createdAt }.
   215â†’
   216â†’    3. `@Get('sent')` -- List sent shares. Calls service.getSentShares(userId). Map to response: { shareId, recipientPublicKey, itemType, ipnsName, itemName, createdAt }.
   217â†’
   218â†’    4. `@Get(':shareId/keys')` -- Get share keys. Param: shareId. Calls service.getShareKeys(shareId, userId). Map each key: { keyType, itemId, encryptedKey (hex) }.
   219â†’
   220â†’    5. `@Post(':shareId/keys')` -- Add share keys. Param: shareId. Body: AddShareKeysDto. Calls service.addShareKeys(shareId, userId, dto). Returns 201.
   221â†’
   222â†’    6. `@Delete(':shareId')` -- Revoke share. Param: shareId. Calls service.revokeShare(shareId, userId). Returns 204.
   223â†’
   224â†’    7. `@Patch(':shareId/hide')` -- Hide share. Param: shareId. Calls service.hideShare(shareId, userId). Returns 204.
   225â†’
   226â†’    8. `@Get('lookup')` -- User lookup. Query param: publicKey. Calls service.lookupUserByPublicKey(publicKey). Returns { userId, publicKey } or 404. Use @Query('publicKey') decorator.
   227â†’
   228â†’    Controller path: `@Controller('shares')`.
   229â†’
   230â†’    **shares.module.ts** -- NestJS module:
   231â†’    ```typescript
   232â†’    @Module({
   233â†’      imports: [
   234â†’        TypeOrmModule.forFeature([Share, ShareKey, User]),
   235â†’      ],
   236â†’      controllers: [SharesController],
   237â†’      providers: [SharesService],
   238â†’      exports: [SharesService],
   239â†’    })
   240â†’    export class SharesModule {}
   241â†’    ```
   242â†’
   243â†’    **app.module.ts** modifications:
   244â†’    1. Import `SharesModule` from `./shares/shares.module`
   245â†’    2. Import `Share` and `ShareKey` from `./shares/entities`
   246â†’    3. Add `Share` and `ShareKey` to the entities array in TypeOrmModule.forRootAsync
   247â†’    4. Add `SharesModule` to the imports array
   248â†’
   249â†’    After all files are saved, run `pnpm api:generate` to regenerate the typed API client for the web app.
   250â†’    Then commit the regenerated client files in `apps/web/src/api/`.
   251â†’
   252â†’  </action>
   253â†’  <verify>
   254â†’    Run `pnpm --filter api build` succeeds.
   255â†’    Run `pnpm api:generate` succeeds.
   256â†’    Run `pnpm --filter web build` succeeds (generated client compiles).
   257â†’    Verify the generated client has share-related endpoints by checking `apps/web/src/api/` for share types.
   258â†’  </verify>
   259â†’  <done>
   260â†’    SharesController has 8 endpoints with JWT auth. SharesModule registered in app.module. Both Share and ShareKey entities in TypeORM config. API client regenerated with typed share endpoints. Full monorepo builds.
   261â†’  </done>
   262â†’</task>
   263â†’
   264â†’</tasks>
   265â†’
   266â†’<verification>
   267â†’- `pnpm --filter api build` passes
   268â†’- `pnpm api:generate` succeeds
   269â†’- `pnpm --filter web build` passes with regenerated client
   270â†’- POST /shares endpoint exists and accepts CreateShareDto
   271â†’- GET /shares/received endpoint exists
   272â†’- DELETE /shares/:shareId endpoint exists
   273â†’- GET /shares/lookup?publicKey=X endpoint exists
   274â†’- All endpoints require JWT authentication
   275â†’</verification>
   276â†’
   277â†’<success_criteria>
   278â†’
   279â†’1. 8 REST endpoints functional with proper JWT auth guards
   280â†’2. Service handles all CRUD operations including soft-delete for revocation
   281â†’3. User lookup endpoint validates publicKey against users table
   282â†’4. API client regenerated -- web app has typed access to all share endpoints
   283â†’5. Full monorepo build succeeds
   284â†’   </success_criteria>
   285â†’
   286â†’<output>
   287â†’After completion, create `.planning/phases/14-user-to-user-sharing/14-02-SUMMARY.md`
   288â†’</output>

content.content:
1â†’# Phase 14: User-to-User Sharing - Context
     2â†’
     3â†’**Gathered:** 2026-02-21
     4â†’**Status:** Ready for planning
     5â†’
     6â†’<domain>
     7â†’## Phase Boundary
     8â†’
     9â†’Users can share encrypted folders and individual files with other CipherBox users while maintaining zero-knowledge guarantees. The server never sees plaintext folderKey/fileKey at any point. This phase covers read-only sharing only â€” read-write sharing and re-sharing are out of scope. User discovery/lookup (by email, username, etc.) is a separate future phase; this phase uses direct public key exchange.
    10â†’
    11â†’</domain>
    12â†’
    13â†’<decisions>
    14â†’## Implementation Decisions
    15â†’
    16â†’### Invitation flow
    17â†’
    18â†’- Share by pasting recipient's secp256k1 public key (uncompressed, 0x04... format)
    19â†’- No email/username lookup â€” recipient's pubkey obtained out-of-band (copy from Settings, send via chat, etc.)
    20â†’- Backend verifies the pasted pubkey belongs to a registered CipherBox user before allowing the share
    21â†’- Instant share â€” no accept/decline flow. Folder/file immediately appears in recipient's "Shared with me"
    22â†’- Recipient can hide/remove unwanted shares from their view (mechanism left to implementation)
    23â†’
    24â†’### Sharing UI & interactions
    25â†’
    26â†’- Share action accessible from **context menu** (quick share) AND **details dialog** (manage existing shares)
    27â†’- Context menu adds "Share" item with `@` icon, between "Move to..." and "Details"
    28â†’- "Shared with me" is a **separate top-level section**, navigated via breadcrumb path `~/shared` (not a sidebar â€” stays consistent with existing breadcrumb-based navigation)
    29â†’- Sharer sees list of recipients as truncated pubkeys (e.g., `0x1a2b...9f0e`)
    30â†’- Share dialog is a modal following existing modal pattern (500px, #003322 border, backdrop)
    31â†’- Share dialog title includes item name: `SHARE: documents/` or `SHARE: report.pdf`
    32â†’- Recipients shown as flat list with per-recipient revoke action
    33â†’- No upload/new-folder/refresh buttons when browsing shared content (read-only)
    34â†’
    35â†’### Revocation & key rotation
    36â†’
    37â†’- **Lazy key rotation**: revoking a share removes the recipient's access record but does NOT immediately rotate the folderKey. Key rotation happens on next folder modification
    38â†’- Per-recipient revoke â€” remove individual recipients while others keep access
    39â†’- Revoke action styled as danger (`--revoke` in `#EF4444`)
    40â†’- Recipient's experience on revoke: folder silently disappears from "Shared with me" on next poll (Claude's discretion on exact behavior)
    41â†’
    42â†’### Permissions model
    43â†’
    44â†’- **Read-only only** for this phase â€” recipients can view and download but not modify
    45â†’- Both **folder-level and file-level sharing** supported (per-file IPNS from Phase 12.6 makes this architecturally possible)
    46â†’- **No re-sharing** â€” readers receive folderKey/fileKey for decryption only, NOT the IPNS private key. Without the IPNS private key, they cannot modify metadata or re-share
    47â†’- Shared items display `[RO]` badge inline in the file list (read-only indicator)
    48â†’- Organization of shared files vs folders in "Shared with me": Claude's discretion
    49â†’
    50â†’### Settings - Public Key
    51â†’
    52â†’- User's public key displayed in Settings page with copy-to-clipboard button
    53â†’- Section header: `// your public key` in terminal comment style
    54â†’- Full key displayed in bordered box, monospace, with word-wrap
    55â†’- Help text: `// share this key with others to receive shared files`
    56â†’- Copy button: `--copy` label, secondary outline style
    57â†’
    58â†’### Claude's Discretion
    59â†’
    60â†’- Exact read-only enforcement UX (hide vs disable upload/modify actions)
    61â†’- How shared items are organized in "Shared with me" (flat list vs grouped)
    62â†’- How recipient removal/hiding works (client-side vs server-side record)
    63â†’- Exact revoke experience for the recipient (silent disappear vs brief "access revoked" state)
    64â†’- Share record storage architecture (server DB vs client-side)
    65â†’- ECIES re-wrapping implementation details
    66â†’- "Shared by me" view (whether sharer can see all their outgoing shares in one place)
    67â†’
    68â†’</decisions>
    69â†’
    70â†’<specifics>
    71â†’## Specific Ideas
    72â†’
    73â†’- Terminal command style for all sharing UI â€” `--share`, `--revoke`, `//` comments, `~/shared` path
    74â†’- Share dialog mimics running a command: `SHARE: filename` as title
    75â†’- Truncated pubkeys shown as `0x1a2b...9f0e` (first 4 + last 4 hex chars)
    76â†’- Access model mirrors a file permission system: readers get decryption keys only, writers (future) would get IPNS signing keys
    77â†’- "Shared with me" column shows `SHARED BY` with truncated pubkey of the sharer
    78â†’
    79â†’</specifics>
    80â†’
    81â†’<deferred>
    82â†’## Deferred Ideas
    83â†’
    84â†’- **User discovery/lookup service** â€” Find users by email, username, or wallet address to get their pubkey automatically. Requires privacy controls (what data your pubkey can be looked up via). Separate phase.
    85â†’- **Read-write sharing** â€” Requires giving recipients the IPNS private key, which enables modification and re-sharing. Multi-writer IPNS is an unsolved problem (noted in research decisions). Future phase.
    86â†’- **Display names for recipients** â€” Show human-readable names instead of truncated pubkeys. Depends on user discovery/profile phase.
    87â†’- **Immediate key rotation on revoke** â€” Upgrade from lazy to immediate rotation if security review warrants it. Easy to change later.
    88â†’- **Share notifications** â€” Notify recipients when new items are shared with them. Currently relies on polling discovery.
    89â†’
    90â†’</deferred>
    91â†’
    92â†’---
    93â†’
    94â†’_Phase: 14-user-to-user-sharing_
    95â†’_Context gathered: 2026-02-21_
    96â†’

1â†’---
     2â†’phase: 14-user-to-user-sharing
     3â†’plan: 01
     4â†’subsystem: crypto, database
     5â†’tags: [ecies, secp256k1, typeorm, sharing, re-wrapping]
     6â†’
     7â†’# Dependency graph
     8â†’requires:

    13â†’provides:

    28â†’    - 'Soft-delete revokedAt for lazy key rotation on share revocation'
    29â†’    - 'Dual-table share architecture: shares (relationship) + share_keys (descendant keys)'

    31â†’key-files:
    32â†’  created:
    33â†’    - packages/crypto/src/ecies/rewrap.ts
    34â†’    - packages/crypto/src/__tests__/rewrap.test.ts

    48â†’patterns-established:

    56â†’---
    57â†’
    58â†’# Phase 14 Plan 01: Crypto Foundation & Share Entities Summary
    59â†’
    60â†’**reWrapKey ECIES utility with 4 test vectors plus Share/ShareKey TypeORM entities for user-to-user sharing**
    61â†’
    62â†’## Performance
    63â†’
    64â†’- **Duration:** 7 min

    70â†’## Accomplishments

    72â†’- reWrapKey function that unwraps with owner's private key and re-wraps with recipient's public key, with plaintext key zeroed from memory
    73â†’- Share entity modeling the share relationship with soft-delete for lazy key rotation

    76â†’
    77â†’## Task Commits

    80â†’
    81â†’1. **Task 1: Create reWrapKey crypto utility with tests** - `2eddb7614` (feat)

    83â†’
    84â†’## Files Created/Modified
    85â†’
    86â†’- `packages/crypto/src/ecies/rewrap.ts` - reWrapKey function: unwrap + re-wrap + zero plaintext
    87â†’- `packages/crypto/src/__tests__/rewrap.test.ts` - 4 test vectors for re-wrapping correctness

    91â†’- `apps/api/src/shares/entities/share.entity.ts` - Share TypeORM entity with user relations
    92â†’- `apps/api/src/shares/entities/share-key.entity.ts` - ShareKey entity with CASCADE delete

    99â†’
   100â†’## Deviations from Plan
   101â†’
   102â†’None - plan executed exactly as written.
   103â†’
   104â†’## Issues Encountered
   105â†’
   106â†’- Pre-commit hook required `pnpm api:generate` when staging API entity files, even though entities are not yet registered in app.module.ts. Generated openapi.json had only formatting changes (no functional impact).
   107â†’
   108â†’## User Setup Required
   109â†’
   110â†’None - no external service configuration required.
   111â†’
   112â†’## Next Phase Readiness
   113â†’
   114â†’- reWrapKey is exported and tested, ready for client-side sharing flows in Plan 03+
   115â†’- Share and ShareKey entities are ready for service/controller wiring in Plan 02
   116â†’- Entities need to be registered in shares.module.ts (Plan 02)
   117â†’
   118â†’---
   119â†’
   120â†’_Phase: 14-user-to-user-sharing_
   121â†’_Completed: 2026-02-21_

content.content:
1â†’import {
     2â†’  Entity,
     3â†’  PrimaryGeneratedColumn,
     4â†’  Column,
     5â†’  CreateDateColumn,
     6â†’  UpdateDateColumn,
     7â†’  ManyToOne,
     8â†’  OneToMany,
     9â†’  JoinColumn,
    10â†’  Index,
    11â†’  Unique,
    12â†’} from 'typeorm';
    13â†’import { User } from '../../auth/entities/user.entity';
    14â†’import { ShareKey } from './share-key.entity';
    15â†’
    16â†’@Entity('shares')
    17â†’@Unique(['sharerId', 'recipientId', 'ipnsName'])
    18â†’export class Share {
    19â†’  @PrimaryGeneratedColumn('uuid')
    20â†’  id!: string;
    21â†’
    22â†’  @Index()
    23â†’  @Column({ type: 'uuid', name: 'sharer_id' })
    24â†’  sharerId!: string;
    25â†’
    26â†’  @ManyToOne(() => User, { onDelete: 'CASCADE' })
    27â†’  @JoinColumn({ name: 'sharer_id' })
    28â†’  sharer!: User;
    29â†’
    30â†’  @Index()
    31â†’  @Column({ type: 'uuid', name: 'recipient_id' })
    32â†’  recipientId!: string;
    33â†’
    34â†’  @ManyToOne(() => User, { onDelete: 'CASCADE' })
    35â†’  @JoinColumn({ name: 'recipient_id' })
    36â†’  recipient!: User;
    37â†’
    38â†’  @Column({ type: 'varchar', length: 10, name: 'item_type' })
    39â†’  itemType!: 'folder' | 'file';
    40â†’
    41â†’  @Index()
    42â†’  @Column({ type: 'varchar', length: 255, name: 'ipns_name' })
    43â†’  ipnsName!: string;
    44â†’
    45â†’  /**
    46â†’   * Display name of the shared item (plaintext).
    47â†’   * Privacy impact is minimal -- server already knows user IDs involved.
    48â†’   */
    49â†’  @Column({ type: 'varchar', length: 255, name: 'item_name' })
    50â†’  itemName!: string;
    51â†’
    52â†’  /**
    53â†’   * The shared item's key (folderKey or parent folderKey) wrapped
    54â†’   * with the recipient's secp256k1 public key via ECIES.
    55â†’   * Server never sees the plaintext key.
    56â†’   */
    57â†’  @Column({ type: 'bytea', name: 'encrypted_key' })
    58â†’  encryptedKey!: Buffer;
    59â†’
    60â†’  /**
    61â†’   * Recipient has hidden/dismissed this share from their view.
    62â†’   */
    63â†’  @Column({ type: 'boolean', name: 'hidden_by_recipient', default: false })
    64â†’  hiddenByRecipient!: boolean;
    65â†’
    66â†’  /**
    67â†’   * Soft-delete timestamp for lazy key rotation.
    68â†’   * null = active share, timestamp = revoked pending rotation.
    69â†’   * On next folder modification, sharer rotates folderKey and hard-deletes.
    70â†’   */
    71â†’  @Column({ type: 'timestamp', name: 'revoked_at', nullable: true })
    72â†’  revokedAt!: Date | null;
    73â†’
    74â†’  @OneToMany(() => ShareKey, (shareKey) => shareKey.share, { cascade: true })
    75â†’  shareKeys!: ShareKey[];
    76â†’
    77â†’  @CreateDateColumn({ name: 'created_at' })
    78â†’  createdAt!: Date;
    79â†’
    80â†’  @UpdateDateColumn({ name: 'updated_at' })
    81â†’  updatedAt!: Date;
    82â†’}
    83â†’

1â†’import {
     2â†’  Entity,
     3â†’  PrimaryGeneratedColumn,
     4â†’  Column,
     5â†’  CreateDateColumn,
     6â†’  ManyToOne,
     7â†’  JoinColumn,
     8â†’  Index,
     9â†’  Unique,
    10â†’} from 'typeorm';
    11â†’import { Share } from './share.entity';
    12â†’
    13â†’@Entity('share_keys')
    14â†’@Unique(['shareId', 'keyType', 'itemId'])
    15â†’export class ShareKey {
    16â†’  @PrimaryGeneratedColumn('uuid')
    17â†’  id!: string;
    18â†’
    19â†’  @Index()
    20â†’  @Column({ type: 'uuid', name: 'share_id' })
    21â†’  shareId!: string;
    22â†’
    23â†’  @ManyToOne(() => Share, (share) => share.shareKeys, { onDelete: 'CASCADE' })
    24â†’  @JoinColumn({ name: 'share_id' })
    25â†’  share!: Share;
    26â†’
    27â†’  /**
    28â†’   * Type of key stored: 'file' for fileKey, 'folder' for subfolder folderKey.
    29â†’   */
    30â†’  @Column({ type: 'varchar', length: 10, name: 'key_type' })
    31â†’  keyType!: 'file' | 'folder';
    32â†’
    33â†’  /**
    34â†’   * UUID of the file or subfolder this key belongs to.
    35â†’   */
    36â†’  @Index()
    37â†’  @Column({ type: 'varchar', length: 255, name: 'item_id' })
    38â†’  itemId!: string;
    39â†’
    40â†’  /**
    41â†’   * The file key or subfolder key wrapped with the recipient's
    42â†’   * secp256k1 public key via ECIES. Server never sees the plaintext key.
    43â†’   */
    44â†’  @Column({ type: 'bytea', name: 'encrypted_key' })
    45â†’  encryptedKey!: Buffer;
    46â†’
    47â†’  @CreateDateColumn({ name: 'created_at' })
    48â†’  createdAt!: Date;
    49â†’}
    50â†’

    25â†’    - 'DELETE /shares/:shareId soft-deletes a share (sets revokedAt)'
    26â†’    - 'PATCH /shares/:shareId/hide marks a share as hidden by recipient'
    27â†’    - 'GET /users/lookup?publicKey=X verifies publicKey belongs to registered user'

    38â†’    - path: 'apps/api/src/shares/dto/create-share.dto.ts'

    42â†’    - from: 'apps/api/src/shares/shares.controller.ts'

    92â†’  <action>
    93â†’    **create-share.dto.ts** -- Validated DTO for POST /shares:
    94â†’
    95â†’    ```typescript
    96â†’    import { IsString, IsIn, IsArray, ValidateNested, IsOptional } from 'class-validator';
    97â†’    import { Type } from 'class-transformer';
    98â†’
    99â†’    class ChildKeyDto {
   100â†’      @IsString()
   101â†’      @IsIn(['file', 'folder'])
   102â†’      keyType!: 'file' | 'folder';
   103â†’
   104â†’      @IsString()
   105â†’      itemId!: string;
   106â†’
   107â†’      @IsString()
   108â†’      encryptedKey!: string; // hex-encoded ECIES ciphertext
   109â†’    }
   110â†’
   111â†’    export class CreateShareDto {
   112â†’      @IsString()
   113â†’      recipientPublicKey!: string; // 0x04... uncompressed secp256k1
   114â†’
   115â†’      @IsString()
   116â†’      @IsIn(['folder', 'file'])
   117â†’      itemType!: 'folder' | 'file';
   118â†’
   119â†’      @IsString()
   120â†’      ipnsName!: string; // k51... IPNS name of the shared item
   121â†’
   122â†’      @IsString()
   123â†’      itemName!: string; // Display name for the shared item
   124â†’
   125â†’      @IsString()
   126â†’      encryptedKey!: string; // hex-encoded root key wrapped for recipient
   127â†’
   128â†’      @IsArray()
   129â†’      @ValidateNested({ each: true })
   130â†’      @Type(() => ChildKeyDto)
   131â†’      @IsOptional()
   132â†’      childKeys?: ChildKeyDto[]; // Re-wrapped descendant keys
   133â†’    }
   134â†’    ```
   135â†’
   136â†’    **share-key.dto.ts** -- DTO for POST /shares/:shareId/keys (adding keys to existing share):
   137â†’
   138â†’    ```typescript
   139â†’    import { IsString, IsIn, IsArray, ValidateNested } from 'class-validator';
   140â†’    import { Type } from 'class-transformer';
   141â†’
   142â†’    class ShareKeyEntryDto {
   143â†’      @IsString()
   144â†’      @IsIn(['file', 'folder'])
   145â†’      keyType!: 'file' | 'folder';
   146â†’
   147â†’      @IsString()
   148â†’      itemId!: string;
   149â†’
   150â†’      @IsString()
   151â†’      encryptedKey!: string; // hex-encoded
   152â†’    }
   153â†’
   154â†’    export class AddShareKeysDto {
   155â†’      @IsArray()
   156â†’      @ValidateNested({ each: true })
   157â†’      @Type(() => ShareKeyEntryDto)
   158â†’      keys!: ShareKeyEntryDto[];
   159â†’    }
   160â†’    ```
   161â†’
   162â†’    **index.ts** barrel exporting both DTOs.
   163â†’
   164â†’    **shares.service.ts** -- Service with these methods:
   165â†’
   166â†’    1. `createShare(sharerId: string, dto: CreateShareDto): Promise<Share>` -- Look up recipient by publicKey in users table. Validate recipient exists and is not the sharer. Check for existing active share (same sharer, recipient, ipnsName). Create Share record with encryptedKey as Buffer.from(dto.encryptedKey, 'hex'). If childKeys provided, create ShareKey records. Return the created share.
   167â†’
   168â†’    2. `getReceivedShares(recipientId: string): Promise<Share[]>` -- Find shares where recipientId matches and revokedAt IS NULL and hiddenByRecipient is false. Include the sharer relation to get sharerPublicKey. Return ordered by createdAt DESC.
   169â†’
   170â†’    3. `getSentShares(sharerId: string): Promise<Share[]>` -- Find shares where sharerId matches and revokedAt IS NULL. Include recipient relation. Return ordered by createdAt DESC.
   171â†’
   172â†’    4. `getShareKeys(shareId: string, userId: string): Promise<ShareKey[]>` -- Verify the share exists and userId is either sharer or recipient. Return all ShareKey records for that share.
   173â†’
   174â†’    5. `addShareKeys(shareId: string, sharerId: string, dto: AddShareKeysDto): Promise<void>` -- Verify share exists and userId is the sharer. For each key entry, upsert ShareKey record (insert or update encrypted_key if already exists for that itemId).
   175â†’
   176â†’    6. `revokeShare(shareId: string, sharerId: string): Promise<void>` -- Verify share exists and userId is the sharer. Soft-delete: set revokedAt to current timestamp. Do NOT delete ShareKey records yet (lazy rotation will hard-delete later).
   177â†’
   178â†’    7. `hideShare(shareId: string, recipientId: string): Promise<void>` -- Verify share exists and userId is the recipient. Set hiddenByRecipient to true.
   179â†’
   180â†’    8. `lookupUserByPublicKey(publicKey: string): Promise<{ userId: string; publicKey: string } | null>` -- Query users table by publicKey. Return userId and publicKey if found, null otherwise.
   181â†’
   182â†’    9. `getPendingRotations(sharerId: string): Promise<Share[]>` -- Find shares where sharerId matches and revokedAt IS NOT NULL. These are shares waiting for key rotation.
   183â†’
   184â†’    10. `completeRotation(shareId: string): Promise<void>` -- Hard-delete the share record and all associated ShareKey records (after key rotation is complete).
   185â†’
   186â†’    Inject `@InjectRepository(Share)` and `@InjectRepository(ShareKey)` and `@InjectRepository(User)` (from AuthModule -- import User entity).
   187â†’
   188â†’    Follow the DeviceApproval service pattern for error handling: throw `NotFoundException` when share not found, `ForbiddenException` when user is not authorized, `ConflictException` when share already exists.
   189â†’
   190â†’  </action>
   191â†’  <verify>
   192â†’    Run `pnpm --filter api build` succeeds (service compiles without type errors).
   193â†’  </verify>
   194â†’  <done>
   195â†’    SharesService has all 10 methods implementing the share record CRUD. DTOs have proper class-validator decorations.
   196â†’  </done>
   197â†’</task>
   198â†’
   199â†’<task type="auto">
   200â†’  <name>Task 2: Create shares controller, module, register in app.module, and regenerate API client</name>
   201â†’  <files>
   202â†’    apps/api/src/shares/shares.controller.ts
   203â†’    apps/api/src/shares/shares.module.ts
   204â†’    apps/api/src/app.module.ts
   205â†’  </files>
   206â†’  <action>
   207â†’    **shares.controller.ts** -- REST controller with JWT auth guard. Follow DeviceApproval controller pattern:
   208â†’
   209â†’    All endpoints require `@UseGuards(JwtAuthGuard)` and extract userId from `@Req() req`.
   210â†’
   211â†’    Endpoints:
   212â†’    1. `@Post()` -- Create share. Body: CreateShareDto. Calls service.createShare(userId, dto). Returns 201 with share record (serialize encryptedKey as hex, include shareId).
   213â†’
   214â†’    2. `@Get('received')` -- List received shares. Calls service.getReceivedShares(userId). Map each share to response DTO: { shareId, sharerPublicKey (from sharer relation), itemType, ipnsName, itemName, encryptedKey (Buffer to hex), createdAt }.
   215â†’
   216â†’    3. `@Get('sent')` -- List sent shares. Calls service.getSentShares(userId). Map to response: { shareId, recipientPublicKey, itemType, ipnsName, itemName, createdAt }.
   217â†’
   218â†’    4. `@Get(':shareId/keys')` -- Get share keys. Param: shareId. Calls service.getShareKeys(shareId, userId). Map each key: { keyType, itemId, encryptedKey (hex) }.
   219â†’
   220â†’    5. `@Post(':shareId/keys')` -- Add share keys. Param: shareId. Body: AddShareKeysDto. Calls service.addShareKeys(shareId, userId, dto). Returns 201.
   221â†’
   222â†’    6. `@Delete(':shareId')` -- Revoke share. Param: shareId. Calls service.revokeShare(shareId, userId). Returns 204.
   223â†’
   224â†’    7. `@Patch(':shareId/hide')` -- Hide share. Param: shareId. Calls service.hideShare(shareId, userId). Returns 204.
   225â†’
   226â†’    8. `@Get('lookup')` -- User lookup. Query param: publicKey. Calls service.lookupUserByPublicKey(publicKey). Returns { userId, publicKey } or 404. Use @Query('publicKey') decorator.
   227â†’
   228â†’    Controller path: `@Controller('shares')`.
   229â†’
   230â†’    **shares.module.ts** -- NestJS module:
   231â†’    ```typescript
   232â†’    @Module({
   233â†’      imports: [
   234â†’        TypeOrmModule.forFeature([Share, ShareKey, User]),
   235â†’      ],
   236â†’      controllers: [SharesController],
   237â†’      providers: [SharesService],
   238â†’      exports: [SharesService],
   239â†’    })
   240â†’    export class SharesModule {}
   241â†’    ```
   242â†’
   243â†’    **app.module.ts** modifications:
   244â†’    1. Import `SharesModule` from `./shares/shares.module`
   245â†’    2. Import `Share` and `ShareKey` from `./shares/entities`
   246â†’    3. Add `Share` and `ShareKey` to the entities array in TypeOrmModule.forRootAsync
   247â†’    4. Add `SharesModule` to the imports array
   248â†’
   249â†’    After all files are saved, run `pnpm api:generate` to regenerate the typed API client for the web app.
   250â†’    Then commit the regenerated client files in `apps/web/src/api/`.
   251â†’
   252â†’  </action>
   253â†’  <verify>
   254â†’    Run `pnpm --filter api build` succeeds.
   255â†’    Run `pnpm api:generate` succeeds.
   256â†’    Run `pnpm --filter web build` succeeds (generated client compiles).
   257â†’    Verify the generated client has share-related endpoints by checking `apps/web/src/api/` for share types.
   258â†’  </verify>
   259â†’  <done>
   260â†’    SharesController has 8 endpoints with JWT auth. SharesModule registered in app.module. Both Share and ShareKey entities in TypeORM config. API client regenerated with typed share endpoints. Full monorepo builds.
   261â†’  </done>
   262â†’</task>
   263â†’
   264â†’</tasks>
   265â†’
   266â†’<verification>
   267â†’- `pnpm --filter api build` passes
   268â†’- `pnpm api:generate` succeeds
   269â†’- `pnpm --filter web build` passes with regenerated client
   270â†’- POST /shares endpoint exists and accepts CreateShareDto
   271â†’- GET /shares/received endpoint exists
   272â†’- DELETE /shares/:shareId endpoint exists
   273â†’- GET /shares/lookup?publicKey=X endpoint exists
   274â†’- All endpoints require JWT authentication
   275â†’</verification>
   276â†’
   277â†’<success_criteria>
   278â†’
   279â†’1. 8 REST endpoints functional with proper JWT auth guards
   280â†’2. Service handles all CRUD operations including soft-delete for revocation
   281â†’3. User lookup endpoint validates publicKey against users table
   282â†’4. API client regenerated -- web app has typed access to all share endpoints
   283â†’5. Full monorepo build succeeds
   284â†’   </success_criteria>
   285â†’
   286â†’<output>
   287â†’After completion, create `.planning/phases/14-user-to-user-sharing/14-02-SUMMARY.md`
   288â†’</output>
   289â†’

git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
feat(14-02): add shares controller, module, register in app.module, regenerate API client

- SharesController with 8 JWT-authenticated endpoints: create, received,
  sent, lookup, getKeys, addKeys, revoke, hide
- SharesModule registered in app.module with Share/ShareKey entities
- OpenAPI generator script updated with shares controller/service
- API client regenerated with typed share endpoints and model DTOs

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

1â†’# Summary Template
     2â†’
     3â†’Template for `.planning/phases/XX-name/{phase}-{plan}-SUMMARY.md` - phase completion documentation.
     4â†’
     5â†’---
     6â†’
     7â†’## File Template
     8â†’
     9â†’```markdown
    10â†’---
    11â†’phase: XX-name
    12â†’plan: YY
    13â†’subsystem: [primary category: auth, payments, ui, api, database, infra, testing, etc.]
    14â†’tags: [searchable tech: jwt, stripe, react, postgres, prisma]
    15â†’
    16â†’# Dependency graph
    17â†’requires:
    18â†’  - phase: [prior phase this depends on]
    19â†’    provides: [what that phase built that this uses]
    20â†’provides:
    21â†’  - [bullet list of what this phase built/delivered]
    22â†’affects: [list of phase names or keywords that will need this context]
    23â†’
    24â†’# Tech tracking
    25â†’tech-stack:
    26â†’  added: [libraries/tools added in this phase]
    27â†’  patterns: [architectural/code patterns established]
    28â†’
    29â†’key-files:
    30â†’  created: [important files created]
    31â†’  modified: [important files modified]
    32â†’
    33â†’key-decisions:
    34â†’  - "Decision 1"
    35â†’  - "Decision 2"
    36â†’
    37â†’patterns-established:
    38â†’  - "Pattern 1: description"
    39â†’  - "Pattern 2: description"
    40â†’
    41â†’# Metrics
    42â†’duration: Xmin
    43â†’completed: YYYY-MM-DD
    44â†’---
    45â†’
    46â†’# Phase [X]: [Name] Summary
    47â†’
    48â†’**[Substantive one-liner describing outcome - NOT "phase complete" or "implementation finished"]**
    49â†’
    50â†’## Performance
    51â†’
    52â†’- **Duration:** [time] (e.g., 23 min, 1h 15m)
    53â†’- **Started:** [ISO timestamp]
    54â†’- **Completed:** [ISO timestamp]
    55â†’- **Tasks:** [count completed]
    56â†’- **Files modified:** [count]
    57â†’
    58â†’## Accomplishments
    59â†’- [Most important outcome]
    60â†’- [Second key accomplishment]
    61â†’- [Third if applicable]
    62â†’
    63â†’## Task Commits
    64â†’
    65â†’Each task was committed atomically:
    66â†’
    67â†’1. **Task 1: [task name]** - `abc123f` (feat/fix/test/refactor)
    68â†’2. **Task 2: [task name]** - `def456g` (feat/fix/test/refactor)
    69â†’3. **Task 3: [task name]** - `hij789k` (feat/fix/test/refactor)
    70â†’
    71â†’**Plan metadata:** `lmn012o` (docs: complete plan)
    72â†’
    73â†’_Note: TDD tasks may have multiple commits (test â†’ feat â†’ refactor)_
    74â†’
    75â†’## Files Created/Modified
    76â†’- `path/to/file.ts` - What it does
    77â†’- `path/to/another.ts` - What it does
    78â†’
    79â†’## Decisions Made
    80â†’[Key decisions with brief rationale, or "None - followed plan as specified"]
    81â†’
    82â†’## Deviations from Plan
    83â†’
    84â†’[If no deviations: "None - plan executed exactly as written"]
    85â†’
    86â†’[If deviations occurred:]
    87â†’
    88â†’### Auto-fixed Issues
    89â†’
    90â†’**1. [Rule X - Category] Brief description**
    91â†’- **Found during:** Task [N] ([task name])
    92â†’- **Issue:** [What was wrong]
    93â†’- **Fix:** [What was done]
    94â†’- **Files modified:** [file paths]
    95â†’- **Verification:** [How it was verified]
    96â†’- **Committed in:** [hash] (part of task commit)
    97â†’
    98â†’[... repeat for each auto-fix ...]
    99â†’
   100â†’---
   101â†’
   102â†’**Total deviations:** [N] auto-fixed ([breakdown by rule])
   103â†’**Impact on plan:** [Brief assessment - e.g., "All auto-fixes necessary for correctness/security. No scope creep."]
   104â†’
   105â†’## Issues Encountered
   106â†’[Problems and how they were resolved, or "None"]
   107â†’
   108â†’[Note: "Deviations from Plan" documents unplanned work that was handled automatically via deviation rules. "Issues Encountered" documents problems during planned work that required problem-solving.]
   109â†’
   110â†’## User Setup Required
   111â†’
   112â†’[If USER-SETUP.md was generated:]
   113â†’**External services require manual configuration.** See [{phase}-USER-SETUP.md](./{phase}-USER-SETUP.md) for:
   114â†’- Environment variables to add
   115â†’- Dashboard configuration steps
